sections.heading: Common Expressions
sections.content:
Common expressions are the building blocks of natural Japanese conversation. These phrases go beyond literal translations and capture the essence of how native speakers actually communicate in everyday situations.

Textbook: 今何時ですか Common: 今何時？ "What time is it now?" Natural speech patterns Contextual appropriateness

children.heading: Showing understanding
children.content: そうですね "That's right / I see" なるほど "I see / That makes sense" 確かに "Certainly / Indeed" まあね "Well, yeah" Understanding and agreement Common in conversation

children.heading: Strong agreement
children.content: 本当に "Really / Truly" 全くその通り "Exactly / Absolutely right" 間違いない "No doubt / For sure" だよね "Right? / Isn't it?" Emphatic agreement Casual to formal

children.heading: Mild surprise
children.content: えっ "Eh? / What?" へえ "Huh / Oh really?" そうなんだ "Is that so?" マジで "Seriously?" (casual) Natural reactions Common interjections

children.heading: Strong surprise
children.content: 本当に？ "Really?" 嘘！ "No way! / Literally: Lie!" 信じられない "I can't believe it" びっくりした "I was surprised" Genuine shock Everyday usage

children.heading: Filler words
children.content: えーと "Um / Let me see" あのー "Well / Um" そうですね "Let's see" ちょっと "A moment" Natural pauses Thinking time

children.heading: Expressing uncertainty
children.content: どうかな "I wonder / Not sure" 分からない "I don't know" 多分 "Maybe / Probably" かもしれない "Might be" Showing doubt Avoiding assertion

children.heading: Polite requests
children.content: すみません "Excuse me" お願いします "Please" ～てもらえますか "Could you...?" ～ていただけますか "Would you kindly...?" Polite and practical Daily necessity

children.heading: Casual requests
children.content: ちょっと "Hey / Quick favor" 悪いけど "Sorry but" ～てくれる？ "Can you...?" 頼むよ "Come on / Please" Among friends Informal settings

children.heading: Soft refusals
children.content: ちょっと... "Well... (implied no)" 難しいです "It's difficult" 遠慮します "I'll refrain" 今日はちょっと "Today is a bit..." Indirect rejection Culturally appropriate

children.heading: Direct refusals
children.content: 無理です "It's impossible" できません "I can't" ごめんなさい "I'm sorry (no)" やめとく "I'll pass" (casual) More direct Still polite

children.heading: Confirming comprehension
children.content: 分かりますか "Do you understand?" 大丈夫ですか "Are you okay? / Is it alright?" いいですか "Is it good? / Okay?" ～ですよね "...right?" Ensuring clarity Common in explanations

children.heading: Asking for repetition
children.content: もう一度お願いします "Once more please" すみません、何ですか "Sorry, what was that?" 聞こえませんでした "I couldn't hear" ゆっくり話してください "Please speak slowly" No shame in asking Better than misunderstanding

children.heading: Encouraging continuation
children.content: それで？ "And then?" へえ、そうなんだ "Oh really?" 続けて "Go on / Continue" もっと教えて "Tell me more" Active listening Engagement signals

children.heading: Expressing interest
children.content: 面白い "Interesting" いいね "That's nice / Cool" すごい "Amazing / Wow" さすが "As expected (of you)" Positive reactions Genuine interest

children.heading: Temporal markers
children.content: ちょうど "Just now / Exactly" さっき "A moment ago" もうすぐ "Soon / Almost" 今ちょっと "Right now (busy)" Time context Frequently used

children.heading: Duration and frequency
children.content: いつも "Always" たまに "Sometimes" 最近 "Recently" この間 "The other day" Temporal relationship Natural conversation

children.heading: Intensifiers
children.content: とても "Very" かなり "Quite / Pretty" めちゃくちゃ "Extremely" (casual) 超 "Super" (casual) Degree markers Common modifiers

children.heading: Minimizers
children.content: ちょっと "A little / Somewhat" あまり～ない "Not very" 全然～ない "Not at all" ほとんど～ない "Hardly / Barely" Downplaying Modest expression

children.heading: Sympathy expressions
children.content: それは大変ですね "That's tough" お気の毒に "I'm sorry to hear that" 残念ですね "That's unfortunate" 困りましたね "That's troubling" Showing empathy Appropriate response

children.heading: Offering support
children.content: 何かできることは？ "Is there anything I can do?" 大丈夫？ "Are you okay?" 頑張って "Hang in there" 心配しないで "Don't worry" Supportive phrases Caring response

children.heading: Phone-specific
children.content: もしもし "Hello" (phone only) お電話変わりました "This is [name] now" 少々お待ちください "Please wait a moment" また後でかけます "I'll call again later" Phone etiquette Specific context

children.heading: Messaging conventions
children.content: 了解 "Roger / Understood" おつかれさま "Good work" (common message) よろしく "Please / Thanks" OK "Okay" (borrowed) Text and chat Modern usage

children.heading: Customer phrases
children.content: 見てるだけです "Just looking" これください "I'll take this" いくらですか "How much?" 袋いりません "I don't need a bag" Shopping essentials Practical daily use

children.heading: Staff responses
children.content: いらっしゃいませ "Welcome" かしこまりました "Certainly" 少々お待ちください "One moment please" ありがとうございました "Thank you very much" Service industry Standard phrases

children.heading: Topic transitions
children.content: ところで "By the way" そういえば "Speaking of which" 話は変わるけど "Changing the subject" あ、そうだ "Oh, that reminds me" Smooth transitions Natural flow

children.heading: Softening opinions
children.content: 個人的には "Personally" 私の意見では "In my opinion" と思います "I think" ～じゃないかな "Don't you think...?" Humble expression Not imposing

children.heading: Showing preference
children.content: ～の方がいい "... is better" どちらかというと "If I had to choose" ～が好き "I like..." できれば "If possible / Preferably" Personal taste Diplomatic phrasing

children.heading: Among friends
children.content: マジ "Seriously / Really" ヤバイ "Crazy / Awesome / Bad" うざい "Annoying" ダサい "Uncool / Lame" Youth language Casual only

children.heading: Exclamations
children.content: やった！ "Yes! / I did it!" しまった！ "Oh no! / Darn!" よかった "I'm glad / That's good" 最高 "The best / Awesome" Emotional reactions Natural outbursts

children.heading: Situation-specific
children.content: At work: お疲れ様です At home: ただいま / おかえり Eating: いただきます / ごちそうさま Meeting: よろしくお願いします Each has its place Cultural rituals

children.heading: Same word, different feelings
children.content: そうですね (Agreeing): "Yes, that's right" (Hesitating): "Well, let me think" (Dismissing): "Yeah, whatever" Context is everything Tone matters

children.heading: Reading between lines
children.content: ちょっと... = Usually means "no" 考えておきます = "I'll think about it" (soft no) そうですね... = May indicate disagreement Indirect communication Cultural awareness needed

children.heading: Common dialect phrases
children.content: じゃん (Kanto): "isn't it?" やん (Kansai): "isn't it?" ばい (Kyushu): sentence ending だべ (Tohoku): "right?" Regional flavor Understanding variety

children.heading: English influence
children.content: OK / オーケー "Okay" ナイス "Nice" グッド "Good" チェック "Check" Modern Japanese International words
